thread.title: Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw tries to turn consistency into playoff success
thread.title_full: Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw tries to turn consistency into playoff success

author: BETH HARRIS
title: Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw tries to turn consistency into playoff success
text:
Los Angeles Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw enters the playoffs with an 11-1 record and 1.22 ERA to go with four complete games, including three shutouts, in 17 starts since July 3. (Kevork Djansezian/Getty Images) Dodgers ace Clayton Kershaw tries to turn consistency into playoff success BETH HARRIS LOS ANGELES — The Associated Press 
Published Wednesday, Oct. 07, 2015 9:34PM EDT 
Last updated Wednesday, Oct. 07, 2015 9:37PM EDT 
No one epitomizes the Los Angeles Dodgers’ recent playoff failures more than Clayton Kershaw. As brilliant as he’s been in his career – winning last year’s NL MVP and three Cy Young Awards – the ace has yet to achieve success in the postseason. 
For someone as deceptively competitive as Kershaw, that kind of collapse is unacceptable. connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
